Reviews.Title: “2-nights in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: djamesburgess
Reviews.Content: Chosen for it's proximity to friends we were visiting and also near the metro station. Hotel was very quiet, probably the season. Room was a bit dark and dreary but the bed was fine. Room rate was excellent considering.

Reviews.Title: “Renovate it now!”
Reviews.Author: Piotr G
Reviews.Content: Rooms definitely need renovation. Location isn't that bad. Good breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Short Break In Madrid”
Reviews.Author: petermac68
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth NH hotel we have booked. We stayed from the 5/312 to the 9/3/12They are used a lot for conferences and by business travellers as well as tourists so you know what to expect. We got it on a flash discount sale of 50% off no cancellation or refund. I think we would have been dissapointed if we paid full price. The interior of ths one seemed a bit tiired but it was very clean and in a very good location just adjacent to Playa Santa Barbera about 20/30 minutes walk away from the the centre which can get very boisterous at night. We paid for an upgrade to a superior room and got a very big room with a huge bathroom. Breakfast was adequate. They don't put the eggs and bacon out they cook it fresh for you so don't think there isn't any just order it. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. To get from the airport we booked the shuttle Aerocity. It was only 16 Euros for two peopple whereas a taxi would cost you about 40E. We used them to get back to the airport. You can get the tube but there are lots of steps to negotiate and I wouldn't recommend it with cases or at peak times. Madrid is very spread out and full of traffic so we used the tube a lot. Buy a three day pass for 13E and it's unlimted and included the buses. Watchout for the pickpockets on the tube and in the centre as they tried to get into my wifes bag twice. There are lots of prostitutes between the Gran Via and Sol which you might find distasteful as they also operate in broad daylight

Reviews.Title: “twixmas”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne D
Reviews.Content: My husband and i travelled here between christmas and new year and spent 3 nights at the Embajada. I thought this hotel was ideal. We could walk, a very pleasant walk, into the centre (Sol) in around 30 minutes. There was a great little breakfast place ( a smoothie bar) with fab bagels, crossiants etc just across the road on the corner. Cheap too. The hotel was value for money. Our room was spacious as was the en suite with a bath too. A few pubs around the area and right next to the Metro station if you dont want to walk home from the center. Took about 10mins by metro. The staff were very helpful and friendly and spoke English. If i had any critisism then it would be that our room looked into the central courtyard ( if you can call it that) and made the room dimly lit and the double bed - which was 2 singles together keep drifting apart! But we were hardly in room as so much to see in city. i would definetly return to this hotel - but ask for a room facing the outside!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Tim H
Reviews.Content: Excellent location beside a metro station with many residential buildings close by. A few good restaurants and a market nearby as well. Staff members speak English and are very accomodating. Rooms are clean and comfortable. WIFI not so reliable.

Reviews.Title: “My first visit to Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Lynda R
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was closest to where my daughter was staying while she is studying in Madrid for school. I was pleasant surprised to have 2 rooms for our stay; a small sitting area with a table and 2 chairs and a padded bench for sitting. the closet has shelves for clothing storage on one side and hanging area on the other. There were 2 twin beds pushed together in the bedroom, a desk/chair, 2 nightstands and a chest with a TV. there is a mini bar/fridge in the chest. the bathroom is large and very clean. This was a great place for us to stay and it is close to the Metro and walking distance to many great places to eat. We did not eat in the hotel but if you are looking for a substanstial breakfast, I suggest finding a VIPS to eat at. The VIPS are great for travellers as they also stock a small supply of prepared foods, a few groceries, and even alcoholic beverages. There is one a short distance from this hotel. I would stay here again if I ever get back to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: Good quality and comfort although I expected a better breakfast. The price was right and the location, but I don't spend too much time in the room. I am thinking to book in another NH Hotel, I usually go for work.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: RWHouw
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in a nice part of the center. Clean rooms in an renovated old appartment building. Great breakfest. You can order fresh cooked supplements at no extra charge. In my opinion the hotel deserves a higher Tripadvisor rating. Rob

Reviews.Title: “Great price for the quality it offers”
Reviews.Author: airdiogo
Reviews.Content: Stayed in NH Embajada for 3 nights in one of the last weekends of August. Because the hotel is not located in the hearth of Madrid the price is lower. But don't let that fool you. Is close enough to go by feet to the central zone (to visit the Museums and all the parks of Madrid) and it has a subway station just in the next corner. The hotel staff is very polite and helpful, and gave us some nice advice and tips related to the nearby zone. In the lobby there's free wi-fi (extended to the breakfast room in the restaurant). The rooms are clean and have enough space for two persons (for an extra 10€ a night you can upgrade the room but I don't see any need for it). The bathroom is gigantic (almost the same size of the room) and clean. The only problem was a not very pleasant smell coming from the sewer that invaded the room during the day. Not sure however if the hotel is to blame for that or the city sewer system is the guilty one. You can also enjoy a very complete breakfast in the hotel for a little more then 9€ (if you book it on advance at the reception). Well worth it in my opinion. This is for sure one of my top choices if i go back to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Typical (nice) NH experience, but some flaws”
Reviews.Author: globezipper
Reviews.Content: To start off, you generally can expect a good value at NH hotels. And this one is no different. The hotel is on a beautiful old apartment building. The rooms are average in size of what you would expect in Madrid for that size. Everything is functional, there are several power sockets in the room, and everything works. Well. Sort of. The lifts (or "elevators" as you may call them if you're from over the pond) are out of inspection for years (one year, one year, two years respectively). The "main" lift has a character of its own. From the outside, it looks a bit like an industrial freezer (this aesthetic detail is probably the nicer thing about it). But as you are going up, or down, it makes a terrible banging noise on one of the floors on your way up every once in a while. I wonder how come the management doesn't really see (or care) about the stickers that say "inspeccion valida hasta..." and then a date several years past. Anyway, I made it out alive, so this is just an anecdote, perhaps by the time you get there this might be fixed ;-) Internet in the room costs about 10 EUR for 24hrs, I think. You can get an unlimited supply of 30 minute free vouchers to use at the reception only. But that is low-speed Internet, and it's not really practical. An even better option is to get a prepaid SIM card, if you have a data stick or a smartphone. There's a Phone House in walking distance. I got myself a prepaid Yoigo SIM card for 20 EUR that features 500 Mb data per month for two months before it expires (unless you recharge it). As you stay at a hotel, probably one of the best ways of really judging the service is how they react when there is a problem. And indeed, during my stay there was a major problem. A hot water pipe burst on the 4th floor, turning that whole floor into a steambath and the corridors of the hotel from the 4th floor down to the street into an adventure spa. It didn't really affect me as I was on the 6th floor - except that I had no running water since the whole system needed to be shut down. I have to say that at that time - even though the staff was clearly with many bigger problems on its hand - they were really nice and accommodating, going out of their way to make the inconvenience as small as possible, offering me to move to another (fancier) NH hotel for the same price - I didn't mind - I just stayed there and wasn't really that inconvenienced apart from the little "swim" across the lobby floor - something out of the ordinary. One thing to remember: when you stay at NH hotels, considering dishing out for the breakfast. It's not really cheap, but well worth it - if you're hungry. There is everything - from the healthy choices to the Mediterranean, to the sweet, to the warm - enjoy! A word of warning: it seems that Madrid now has no more free parking during week days. You will have to get a ticket from a machine and then put it behind your windshield. Immediately next to the hotel, there is a green zone (somewhat more expensive and you can only get a ticket for one hour). Opposite the hotel there is a blue zone (where you can get a ticket for two hours). This is quite annoying, because you'd have to get a ticket every two hours. If not, you'll get a fine for 30 EUR, unless you don't have a ticket at all, in which case you'll get a fine of 90 EUR. There is a parking garage close by. THis has nothing to do with the surroundings of this hotel - it's actually all over Madrid now, I hear. I'll stay there again next time I'm in Madrid, and maybe by then the lifts have been inspected and don't bang anymore ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tiramisu66
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, quite location, 15-20 walk from the centre of Madrid. Near a metro station.Nice clean rooms. The only negative thing was that the staff had very little english, and I don't speak spanish which made any kind of query /conversation very difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Nice breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Hilldale
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, and chose this hotel for the location (we had business in the Chamberi area). Breakfast is a good: 10 euros if you reserve at check-in (or 16 euros without reserving). We were happy we reserved--the buffet presentation is lovely, many healthy selections and types of juice in addition to pastries; coffee from the machine is excellent. They also prepare egg dishes to order. In the evenings, one can walk to the Plaza Olavide, a lovely square ringed with restaurants, bars and outdoor seating. A real community gathering place. The hotel room was fine, though small; the double bed pillows (2) were shapeless and flat. They need to provide either better pillows, or more of them, for people who like to read in bed! (I did ask for more pillows, but never received them...did not follow up because I was too busy....and sleep seems to be an afterthought in Madrid! By the time my husband and I returned from dinner around midnight, I was too tired to read...). The bathroom has shampoo and body gel, and even a toothbrush, but not hair conditioner. Internet is free only in the downstairs lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: hughesef
Reviews.Content: Im a little late in writing this review but I stayed here with a friend in September 2009. We stayed here for 5 days and had a nice experience. The location was great, very close to the metro and an easy walk to many places also. The rooms were clean, spacious, and the bathroom was very big. We did not eat at the hotel, nor did we really ask for help from the staff so cannot comment on either, but overall had a nice experience and the location made staying here worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good position and staying”
Reviews.Author: mynicknameMilano
Reviews.Content: The best feature of Embajada hotel is the position, right outside the center, so that the area is quiet and you can very easily reach it if you have a car, but the town center is still at walking distance (15 min). The rooms are reasonably clean and spacious. In particular you have roller blinds to get dark, not only curtains (not so obvious in Spain). A negative aspect is that some rooms face really close another building that is just something like 5 meters far so that you can't see the sky outside. So if possible ask for a room with view on the street. The breakfast is not included but really good and rich, so it is worth paying. There's a free wifi in the lobby (not perfectly performing though) but if you want it in the room is about 5 euro per hour.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location; monster sized bathroom”
Reviews.Author: wellensian
Reviews.Content: For a the second of a 2 week business trip I picked this hotel for its location in town, but almost next to Alonso Martinez Metro station (for Line 5), having spent the first week at the less interesting NH Balboa. Being in an old building, the rooms vary enormously, and, as usual it is wise to request an exterior room, as interior rooms can be dingy. Anyone needing complete quiet would be advised to avoid this hotel on a main road just off a large traffic junction, but if urban noise does not bother you, it is fine. Most of the rooms are large with polished wood floors and the usual NH furnishings, supplemented at this hotel with stained glass shields in the windows. My bathroom was enormous, with both a bath and the largest walk-in shower I have ever encountered. Condition was a little tired, but this did not detract from the general experience. The restaurant and bar are currently closed for refurbishment, but a good breakfast is served, with plenty of fruit, cold meats, tortilla, croissants etc. and, as always in Spain, good strong coffee. The hotel suited my purposes well and I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Romankiwi
Reviews.Content: NH Embajada is located a few meters from Alonso Martinez metro stop which means it is perfect for visitors to Madrid. We took the metro from the airport, and with one change were at the hotel within 45 minutes for the grand price of 2 euros! Check in was smooth, room was ready and clean. One small problem was that the housemaid had not left soap etc. A quick trip to reception solved the problem and from then on, shampoo, soap etc were replaced when used up. Rooms facing the back of the hotel (a wall) are quiet. The breakfast buffet is excellent: cereals, juices, breads, rolls, sweet rolls, bacon, eggs, chorizo, cheeses, tortilla, ham, fresh fruits, yoghurts, etc etc. The breakfast staff were courteous and willing but sometimes overwhelmed when numbers were great. WiFi is free in the lobby (30 minute intervals which can be "renewed"), but expensive in the rooms (€5 for 30 minutes, €10 for 24 hours - continuous). There is a mini bar in the room. A supermarket is 2 blocks away. Reception staff were friendly and helpful. Check out was also smooth and quick. NH Embajada is a perfect place to stay in Madrid. We would definitely stay there again and have no hesitation recommending the hotel to anyone visiting Madrid for tourism or business.

Reviews.Title: “NH Embajada Madrid loved the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: occhi21
Reviews.Content: The hotel in my opinion is in a great area. It is across the street from the Alfonso Mart metro stop, and is a simple 15 min walk to the city center of Madrid.You are just north of a the Chuca area of Madrid, which is the gay/trendy area of the city. The staff was super friendly and nice esp when they heard that we were on our honeymoon. I won this hotel on priceline and for the price it really was a great value!The only downside was that the hotel staff gave us a corner room which was big but it faced the noisy street in which you heard all the traffic and people throughout the night.Our hotel room came with a shower and bathtub so two people can shower at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “not very clean, service was average”
Reviews.Author: olesya
Reviews.Content: Here are the pros and cons of this hotel for each category: * cleanliness: out of 10, I'd give it at most 5. The main areas of the room were clean (i.e., sink, bed, main bathroom floor area). However, there were hairs (not mine because they were different color) on the bathroom stool, in the corners of the shower door, and some dirt on the wood floor in the room by the bed. The tiles in the shower where the water touched had yellow grout, which shows that noone has scrubbed them well for a long, long time. * amenities: again, a 5 out of 10. This is supposedly a hotel for business travellers, and yet they had no iron or alarm clock in the room. From toiletries, there was shampoo, body wash and soap, but no lotion. There was a TV with a substantial number of channels, a nice-sized closet, the bathroom was large and comfortable * service: Some receptionists were nicer then others, but overall I would not give it more then a 6. Room cleaning and service were also average. The first 2 days they did not leave any new shampoo/soap for us, even though we ran out and the empty bottles were left in the shower. we had to call downstairs and ask for it, at which point we were told that we have to come and get it (instead of them bringing it up). * room comfort: rooms were very small, but comfortable. We had two separate beds, but because the room is so small, they were only about 1 inch apart (which was fine with us, but it's basically like sleeping on one big bed, they were so close). I got this hotel by bidding on priceline and, for the very low price that I paid, I think it was still a good choice. But I would definitely NOT stay there again if we had to pay full price, primarily because of cleanliness and service issues.

Reviews.Title: “Ahh... the bells, the bells ...”
Reviews.Author: Ronald100
Reviews.Content: Now I know it for sure: I am suffering from hotel noise fobia. Or am I ? Doors of which the springs are adjusted in such a manner that they do not dampen the noise of closure but actually re-inforce it. This, combined with tile corridor floors and badly insulated room doors, lead to me being woken up many times in the late evenings and early mornings of the 12 (!) business nights I spent here. It seems so easy to fix, but nobody cares. Is it me or is it just Spain? Bring ear plugs. Location of the hotel is good. Rooms are however small and stern, the ones facing the inner patio can even be called gloomy due to the absence of natural light. Try to get a room on the top floor for light and to prevent noise from above. Breakfast was according to Spanish standards, fresh orange juice, cafe cortados if you wanted them and a nice selection of cold cuts, cheeses, tortilla and sweet stuff. The kiwis were very unripe though. Breakfast staff was very friendly as were the front office staff. Would'n't go back because of the noisiness though.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Bouedo
Reviews.Content: Judging by the lack of reviews on here in English I guess this place is a little bit out of the way for most people, although having said that it’s not a bad walk into the centre and all the attractions. I stayed here for two nights in May/June (not consecutive). The hotel is right next to the Alonso Martinez Metro station, it was really easy to find when you come out of the station, I travelled from the airport by Metro and it was an easy trip with just one change – a lot cheaper than getting a taxi. The hotel itself was covered in scaffolding at the time which was a shame as it’s a very impressive building. The staff were really nice and friendly and made me feel very welcome. I e-mailed them on a couple of occasions with some questions and they were always prompt to respond. Both of the rooms I had were clean tidy and a decent size with the usual toiletries etc etc. It was really easy to hook up to an internet connection (although this does have to be paid for separately). I didn’t have breakfast in the hotel but the dining room looked extremely busy when I passed by. There are plenty of nice cafes and bars within walking distance. There is a wonderful little place called Plaza de Olavide just a short walk away and this is full of nice local bars/restaurants serving the local Spanish community – plenty of choice and a great atmosphere if you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of the main tourist areas. It’s worth going to at night. In fact I have just booked to return to the hotel again for a couple of nights in September, this time I booked directly with the hotel and as usual they were very quick and efficient in their response.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice place to be!”
Reviews.Author: ruth&rich
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a nice location very close to the metro. When we first arrived we found that, although our flights had been booked, the website we had used to book the hotel as well had not booked our rooms! The reception staff were extremely helpfull & we had everything sorted at no extra cost to us within 20 minutes. The hotel was very clean and well kept. The rooms were an average size and the bed was very comfortable. The decoration was contemporary and in keeping with the overall design of the hotel. The only downpoints were that the bar was not manned while we were there and the restaurant seemed quite pricey so we ate out! However, this was no hardship as there are plenty of local bars and restaurants to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I truly enjoyed the stay at this hotel. Located centrally close to all transportation. Staff was great and the decoration magnificent. Modern yet cozy. Rooms were average sixe but very nice and very clean.

HotelInfo.Name: NH Embajada
HotelInfo.Address: Santa Engracia 5, 28010 Madrid, Spain
